intro: Stathmostelma pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered stathmostelma, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant produces slender, hairy stems and has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
